alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 4:38PM EDT until July 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. Levisa Fork at Pikeville affecting Pike County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Pikeville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 33.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 34.8 feet this evening. It will then fall to 21.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise to 27.5 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued 10 PM EDT.
